snippet: New York City officials said 10 emergency medical workers had arrived at a medical center in Manhattan after receiving a call that Ms. Rivers had gone into cardiac arrest.
abstract: Details emerge on emergency treatment for comic Joan Rivers at New York City outpatient surgery clinic after she went into cardiac arrest while having throat procedure; city officials say 10 emergency medical workers arrived at medical center after receiving call; her death spurs questions on center's procedures.

byline.original: By ANEMONA HARTOCOLLIS and J. DAVID GOODMAN
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Joseph Goldstein, and research by Susan C. Beachy, Jack Begg and Sheelagh McNeill.

lead_paragraph: New York City officials said 10 emergency medical workers had arrived at a medical center in Manhattan after receiving a call that Ms. Rivers had gone into cardiac arrest.

headline.main: At Surgery Clinic, Rush to Save Joan Rivers’s Life
headline.print_headline: The Rush to Save Rivers’s Life at a Surgery Clinic
